key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares show strong alignment with airline direct pricing, exceeding 80% parity and smaller markups over time.
MSE consistently delivers fares 5–6% below the airline site, with few higher-fare exceptions.
Nearly 90% of GDS fares remain above website prices, reflecting a typical 17% premium.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 82.6% of last-week fares aligned with website prices, climbing 6% from the previous week.
The share of OTA-higher fares fell to 12.8% from 17.9% last week, reflecting fewer premium surcharges.
90% of far-out bookings matched airline rates, achieving the highest alignment level across all segments.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA N/A remained near 2% this week, indicating consistent fare availability.
Over 80% of fares matched the airline, up 6% week over week, signaling stable parity.
OTA-lower fares stayed around 3%; shifts from previous periods were minimal.
OTA-higher fares dropped by 5% vs the prior week, suggesting fewer surcharges.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Same fares rose 8% from last week, while OTA-higher dropped by 7%, improving alignment.
85% of long-haul fares matched the airline, with only minor fluctuations in OTA-higher rates.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 85% fare parity in GB, with only about 9% showing higher OTA pricing.
Non-GB routes see nearly 18% OTA-higher fares, roughly double the GB mark.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: About 16% of close-in bookings were priced higher on OTA, contrasting with just 6% far out.
Advanced bookings show strong price consistency with the airline, supporting stable fare levels.

mse_highlights.line_content: Across most itineraries, MSE delivers fares around 5–6% below website rates, dominating 60–70% of observations.
MSE fares rarely exceed website prices, with near-zero instances of pricier listings.
Around 30–40% of itineraries reflect the same fare as the website, indicating competitive alignment.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Coverage gaps are negligible; less than 1% of itineraries lack an MSE offer.
Roughly one-third of fares match airline site pricing, showing steady consistency.
Practically no routes see higher prices on MSE, signifying a strong competitive advantage.
The majority of itineraries are cheaper on MSE by an estimated 5–6%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Over 60% of short-haul routes show 4–5% lower fares via MSE, with parity on much of the remainder.
Nearly half of long-haul itineraries are 11–12% cheaper on MSE, and about half match the airline’s site.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Up to 84% of GB routes are booked cheaper on MSE, discounted around 6–7% below the airline’s site.
Approximately 43–56% see lower MSE fares with discounts of about 5–7%, though parity remains significant.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Over half of near-term bookings come in 6–7% below the website’s rates, showing substantial last-minute discounts.
Roughly three-quarters of advanced bookings are cheaper via MSE by 5–6%, offering a stabile lead-time advantage.

gds_highlights.line_content: Nearly 89% of GDS fares exceed direct pricing, with a modest uptick from last week.
About 1% of itineraries are cheaper on GDS, indicating low underpricing.
GDS premiums on long-haul routes rose sharply from 60% to 68% last week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Remains under 5% of itineraries, showing slight declines from last week and month.
Below 10% overall, indicating relatively stable alignment with direct fares.
Hovers near 1%, reflecting limited GDS undercuts.
Dominates at nearly 90% and carries about a 17% premium over the website.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Over 95% are priced higher on GDS, holding a consistently strong premium.
Share of higher GDS fares climbed from 60% to 68%, reducing price parity with the website.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 86.6% of GB routes remain higher on GDS, edging up from the previous week.
Over 92% of Non-GB markets show higher fares on GDS, expanding the premium gap.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: About 85% of close-in fares are higher on GDS, showing a slight upward trend.
Over 96% remain priced higher on GDS, underscoring a strong premium for advance bookings.
